title: 下部 黑暗森林 第6节
paragraphs: 在这种指挥系统中，可以说，战舰就像是舰长身体的一部分。目前，在舰队所拥有的695艘恒星级战舰中，集中型指挥系统的有179艘，这些战舰上的指挥官，将是重点审查对象。本来，在审查过程中，所涉及到的战舰都应处于停泊封存状态，但从目前情况看做不到这一点，现在，三大舰队都在积极准备对三体探测器的拦截行动，这是太空舰队对三体入侵者的第一次实战，所有战舰必须随时处于待命状态。”
“那么，首长，这期间必须把集中型指挥系统的舰长权限交给可靠的人。”
章北海说，他一直在猜测自己的任务，但还没猜出来。
“谁可靠呢，”司令官问道，“我们不知道思想钢印的使用范围，更没有钢印族的任何信息，在这种情况下，谁都不可靠，包括我。”
这时，太阳在窗外出现了，虽然从这里看，它的亮度比在地球要弱许多，但当日轮经过司令官身后时，他的身体还是隐没于泛出的光芒中，只有声音传了过来。
“但你们是可靠的，在你们冬眠时，思想钢印还不存在，而你们在两个世纪前被选中，很重要的因素就是忠诚和信念，你们是舰队中目前唯一能找到的可信赖的群体了。所以，舰队决定，把集中型指挥系统的舰长权限交给你们，你们将被任命为执行舰长，原舰长对战舰的所有指令，都要通过你们来向指挥系统发出。”
章北海的眼睛中，有两个小太阳在燃烧，他说：“首长，这恐怕不行。”
“接到任务先说不行，这不是我们的传统吧。”
司令官话中的“我们”和“传统”这两个词让章北海有一种温暖的感觉，他知道，两个世纪前那支军队的血脉仍在太空舰队中延续。
“首长，我们毕竟来自两个世纪前，放到我在海军的那个时候，这就等于让北洋水师的管代来指挥二十一世纪的驱逐舰。”
“你是不是认为邓世昌和刘步蟾真的就不能指挥你们的驱逐舰？他们都有文化，英语很好，可以学习嘛。现在，太空战舰舰长的指挥工作是不涉及技术细节的，只发出宏观命令，战舰对他们是一个黑箱状态。再说，你们作为执行舰长期间，战舰只是停泊在基地，并不起航，你们的任务就是向控制系统传达原舰长的命令。在这之前判断这些命令是否正常，这个通过学习应该能做到。”
“那我们掌握的权限也太大了，可以让原舰长仍掌握这些权限，我们对他们的命令进行监督。”
“仔细想想你就知道这不行，如果钢印族真的存在并占据了关键战位，他们可以采用各种手段避开你们的监督，包括刺杀监督者。你要知道，一艘处于待命状态的集中型指挥系统的战舰，使它起航只需三个命令，到时候一切都来不及的。所以，必须让指挥系统只承认执行舰长的命令。”飘邈之旅小说

交通艇飞过亚洲舰队木星军港，章北海感到自己是飞行在层峦叠障的群山之上，每一道山脉就是一艘停泊的太空战舰。军港此时正运行在木星的背阴面，在行星表面发出的磷光和上方木卫二发出的银白色月光中，这钢铁的群山静静沉睡着。不一会儿，一团耀眼的白光从山脉尽头升起，一瞬间把停泊的舰队照得清晰无比。章北海感觉自己在目睹群山上的日出，舰队甚至在木星汹涌的大气层上投下了一个移动的阴影。直到第二个光团在舰队另一侧升起，章北海才知道它们不是太阳，而是两艘正在入港的军舰，减速时它们的核聚变发动机正对着港口方向。
据送章北海赴任的舰队参谋长介绍，现在港内停泊着四百多艘战舰，相当于亚洲舰队战舰总数的三分之二，亚洲舰队在太阳系内外围空间巡航的其余舰只也将陆续回港。
陶醉于舰队壮观景象中的章北海不得不回到现实中来：“参谋长，这样召回所有舰只，会不会刺激和迫使可能存在的钢印族立即行动？”
“哦，不，命令所有战舰回港是基于另一个理由，这理由是真实的，不是借口，但说起来有些可笑。最近你没看新闻吧？”
“没有，我一直在看‘自然选择’号的资料。”
“不用这么急，从前一段的基础培训看，你们都掌握得很好。下面对工作的熟悉到舰上后按部就班地进行就可以，没你们想的那么难……现在三大舰队都力争承担拦截三体探测器的任务，吵成一团，在昨天的联席会议上总算达成一个初步协议：各舰队的所有战舰全部回港集结，并有一个专门委员会监督这一行动的执行，以免某一舰队擅自出动舰只实施拦截行动。”
“为什么要这样呢？如果任何一方拦截成功，得到的情报和技术信息应该是共享的。”
“不错，这只是一个荣誉问题。同三体世界进行首次接触的舰队，在政治上能得分不少。为什么我说可笑呢？这是一件毫无风险的便宜事，最大的失败也不过是探测器在拦截过程中自毁，所以大家都抢着做这件事。如果这是同三体主力舰队的战斗，各方大概都会想尽办法保存实力，所以说现在的政治，与你们那时也差不多……看，那就是‘自然选择’号。”
在交通艇飞向“自然选择”号的过程中，这座钢铁山峰的巨大渐渐显现出来。
这时，章北海的脑海中浮现出“唐”号的影子。“自然选择”号的外形与那艘两个世纪前的海上航空母舰完全不同，前者圆盘形的主舰体与圆柱形的发动机形成两个完全分离的部分。当“唐”号夭折时，章北海仿佛失去了一个精神家园，尽管那个家园他从未入住过。现在，这艘巨型宇宙飞船又给了他家园的感觉，在“自然选择”号伟岸的舰体上，他那流浪了两个世纪的心灵找到了归宿，他像一个孩子一样扑向某种巨大力量的怀抱。

“自然选择”号是亚洲舰队第三分舰队的旗舰，无论是在吨位还是性能上，它都是舰队首屈一指的。它拥有最新一代的无工质聚变推进系统，全功率推进时，可以加速到光速的百分之十五。它的舰内生态循环系统十分完美，能够进行超长时间续航。事实上，这套生态系统的实验型号七十五年前就在月球上开始了试运行，到目前为止仍未出现任何大的故障和缺陷。“自然选择”号的武器系统也是舰队里最强大的，它那由伽马射线激光、电磁动能炮、高能粒子束和星际鱼雷所构成的四位一体的武器系统，能够单独摧毁一个地球大小的行星的表面。
现在，“自然选择”号已占据了全部视野，从交通艇上只能看到它的一部分，章北海看到，飞船的外壁如镜面般光滑，完美地映出木星的大气海洋，从这个广阔的镜面上，也能看到渐渐驶近的交通艇的映像。
飞船外壁上出现了一个椭圆形的入口，交通艇径直飞入，并很快减速停下，参谋长打开舱门率先出艇。这时章北海略略紧张了一下，因为他意识到交通艇并没有经过过渡舱，但他立刻感到从门外涌入的清新空气。有气压的舱室直接向太空开口，却能够避免舱内空气外泄，这是一种他尚不知晓的技术。
章北海和参谋长身处一个巨大的球体内，最大直径处有足球场大小。太空飞船的舱室普遍采用这种球形结构，飞船加速、减速和转向时，球体的任何一处都可能成为甲板或天花板，而在失重状态下，球体的中心是人员的主要活动空间。
在章北海所来自的时代，太空舱室仍然仿照地球建筑结构，所以他对这种全新的太空舱室结构很不适应。参谋长告诉他，这里是飞船上歼击机的机库，但现在这里没有一架星际歼击机，在球形中央的空间中，悬浮着由“自然选择”号两千名官兵组成的方阵。
早在章北海冬眠前的时候，各国太空军就开始在太空失重状态下进行队列操练，并制定了相应的规范和操典。然而实施起来十分困难，在舱外，人员只能借助航天服上的微型喷汽推进器移动，在舱内则没有任何推进设备，只能通过推舱壁和划动空气来移动和定位。在这种情况下，排成一个整齐的队列是很困难的。九州羽传说小说
现在，看到两千多人在毫无依托的空间中排列成如此严整的悬浮方阵，章北海很是惊讶。现在，人员在失重的舱内移动主要是借助磁力腰带，这种腰带由超导体制成，内部有环形电流，所产生的磁场能够与飞船船舱和廊道中无所不在的磁场相互作用，通过握在手中的一个小小的控制器，就可以在飞船内部自如地移动。
章北海自己现在就系着一条这样的腰带，但要掌握它还需要学习技巧。
章北海看着方阵中的太空战士们。他们都是在舰队中成长的一代人，身材修长，没有地球重力下长大的人的强壮和笨拙，却充满了太空一族的轻灵和敏捷。九州缥缈录小说

在方阵前面有三名军官，章北海的目光最后落在中间的那位美丽的年轻女性身上，她的肩上有四颗星在闪亮，应该是“自然选择”号的舰长。她是太空新人类的典型代表，比起身材高大的章北海来还要高出不少，她从方阵前轻盈地移过来，那高挑苗条的身材像飘浮在空间中的一个飘逸的音符。当她在章北海和参谋长面前停下时，本来飘在后面的秀发很有弹性地在白皙的颈项旁跳动着，她的眼睛充满清澈的阳光和活力，章北海立刻信任了她，因为钢印族不可能有这样的目光。
“我是‘自然选择’号舰长东方延绪。”她向章北海敬礼说，眼睛中露出一种俏皮的挑战，“我代表全舰官兵送给前辈一件礼物。”她向前伸出双手，章北海看到了她拿着的那件东西，外形虽变化很大，但他仍能认出那是一支手枪，“如果真发现我有失败主义思想和逃亡企图，前辈可以用它杀了我。”
到地面去很容易，每一棵巨树建筑的树干就是一根支撑地下城市穹顶的支柱，从树干中乘电梯就可直达地面。其间要穿过三百多米的地层。当罗辑和史强走出电梯时，有种怀旧的感觉，产生这种感觉的原因是：出口大厅的墙壁和地板上没有被激活的显示窗口了，各种信息显示在悬挂于天花板上的真正的显示屏上。这里看上去像以前的地铁站，人不多，大部分人的衣服都不闪亮。
当他们走出大厅的密封门时，一阵热风扑面而来，带着尘土的气息。
“那是我儿子！”大史指着一个正在跑上台阶的男人喊道。罗辑远远地只能看出那人四十多岁的样子，大史这么肯定让他有些惊奇。史强迎着那人快步走下台阶，罗辑没有看他们父子团聚，他的注意力集中在眼前的地面世界上。

天空是黄色的，现在罗辑知道为什么地下城的天空影像要从万米高空拍摄了，从地面看天，只能见到一轮边缘模糊的太阳。沙土覆盖着地面的一切，当车辆从街道上驶过时，都拖着长长的尘尾。现在罗辑又看到了一样过去的东西：在地面上行驶的车。这些车显然不是用汽油驱动的，它们形状各异，有新有旧，但都有一个共同点：车顶上都装着一块像遮阳篷似的片状物。在街道对面，罗辑看到了过去的楼房，它们的窗台上都积满了沙土，大部分窗子不是被封死就是成了一个没有玻璃的黑洞，但有些房间里显然是住着人的，罗辑看到了晾在外面的衣服，甚至还看到了有的窗台上放着的几盆花草。他向远处看，虽然浮着沙尘的空气能见度不高，但他还是很快看到了两个熟悉的建筑轮廓，于是知道这确实是自己两个世纪前度过半生的城市。
罗辑走下台阶，来到那两个激动得互相拥抱捶打的男人旁边，他走近一看这个中年人的样子，就知道史强没有认错人。
“爸，算起来我现在只比你小五岁了。”史晓明说，一边擦去眼角体的泪水。
“还不错，小子，我他妈真怕一个白胡子老头叫我爹呢。”史强大笑着说，然后把罗辑介绍给儿子。
“啊，您好，罗老师，您当初可是世界大名人啊！”史晓明瞪眼打量着罗辑说。
他们三人向停在路边的史晓明的车走去，上车前，罗辑问车顶上那一大片东西是什么。
“天线呗，地面上只能取人家地下城市里漏出来的那点儿电，所以天线就得大些，就这动力也只够在地上跑，飞不起来。”
车开得不快，不知是因为动力不足还是行驶在沙地上的缘故。罗辑看着车窗外沙尘中的城市，有一肚子的问题想问，但史晓明和他父亲说个没完。他插不上嘴。
“妈是危机34年去世的，当时我和你孙女都在她身边。”
“哦，挺好……没把我孙女带来？”
“离婚后跟了她妈，我也查了档案，这孩子是在危机105年去世的，活了八十多岁呢。”
“可惜没见过面儿……你是哪年刑满出来的？”
“以后干了什么？”
“什么都干，开始没出路，继续招摇撞骗呗，后来也干了点儿正经买卖，有了些钱。看到大低谷的苗头后，就冬眠了。那时也没想到后来能好起来，只是想来看看你。”
“咱家的房子还在吗？”
“七十年后又续了产权，但接着住了不长时间就拆迁了，后来买的那一套倒是还在，我也没去看过。”史晓明指指外面，“现在城里的人口还不及我们那时的百分之一，知道这里最不值钱的是什么？就是爸你一辈子供的房子，现在都空着，随便住了。”
罗辑好不容易抓住了一个两人谈话的间隙，问：“苏醒的冬眠者都住在旧城里吗？”
“哪儿啊，都住在外面，城里风沙太大，主要也是没什么事情干。当然也不能住得离地下城太远，否则就取不上电了。”
“你们还能干什么事？”史强问。
“你想想，这年头我们能干孩子们不能干的是什么？种地呗！”同其他冬眠者一样，不管法律年龄如何，史晓明还是习惯把现代人叫“孩子们”。
车出了城市，向西驶去，沙尘小了些，公路露了出来。罗辑认出这就是当年的京石高速公路。现在，路两旁都是漫漫黄沙，过去的建筑还都屹立在沙中，但真正使沙化的华北平原显出生机的，是一处处由稀疏的树林围起来的小绿洲，据史晓明说，这些地方就是冬眠者的居住点。
车驶入了一个绿洲，这是被防沙林围起来的一个居民小区。史晓明说这叫新生活五村。一下车，罗辑就有时光倒流的感觉，他看到了一排排熟悉的六层居民楼，楼前的空地上，有坐在石凳上下棋的老人和推着婴儿车的母亲，在从沙土中长出的稀疏的草坪上，有几个孩子在玩足球……
史晓明家住在六楼，他现在的妻子比他小九岁，是危机21年因肝癌冬眠的，现在十分健康，他们有一个刚满四岁的儿子，孩子叫史强祖爷爷。
为史强和罗辑接风的午宴很丰盛，都是地道的农产品，还有附近农场产的鸡和猪肉，甚至酒都是自酿的。邻居的三个男人也被叫过来一起吃。他们和史晓明一家一样，都是较早的几批冬眠者。那时冬眠是一件十分昂贵的事，所以这些人当初都是很富有的社会上层人士或他们的子女，但现在，跨越了一百多年的岁月相聚在此，大家都是普通人了。史晓明特别介绍一位邻居，说他叫张延。是当年被他骗过的张援朝的孙子。
“您不是让我把骗人家的钱都还上吗？我出去后就开始还了，因此认识了延子，当时他刚大学毕业。我们受了他们家两个老邻居的启发，做起了殡葬业务，我们的公司名字叫高深公司。高是指太空葬，除了送骨灰出太阳系，后来发展到可以把整个遗体发射出去，当然价钱不低；深是指矿井葬，开始用的是废矿井，后来也挖掘新的，反正都是防三体人掘墓呗。”
被史晓明叫作延子的人看上去有些老了，五六十岁的样子，晓明解释说延子中间苏醒过三十多年，之后才再次冬眠。
“你们这里在法律上是什么地位呢？”罗辑问。
史晓明说：“与现代人居住区完全平等的地位，我们算城市的远郊区，有正规的区政府。这里住的也不全是冬眠者，也有现代人城里也常有人到这里来玩儿。”
张延接着说：“我们都管现代人叫点墙的，因为他们刚来时总不由自主地向墙上点，想激活些什么。”
“这里日子过得还可以吗？”史强问。
几个人都说还不错。
“可我路上看到你们种的地，庄稼长成那德性，能养活人？”
“怎么不能？现在在城市里，农产品都属于奢侈品……其实政府对冬眠者还是相当不错的，就是什么都不干，靠国家给的补贴也能过舒服日子。但总得找点儿事干，要说冬眠人会种地那是瞎说，当初谁也不是农民，但我们也只有这个可干了。”
谈话很快转移到前两个世纪的近代史上。
“大低谷是怎么回事，”罗辑问出了他早想问的问题。
人们的面容一下子都凝重起来，史晓明看看饭快吃完了，才把话题继续下去：
“你们这些天来多少也知道一些吧，这说起来话长了。你们冬眠后的十几年里，日子过得还行，但后来，世界经济转型加速，生活水平一天天下降，政治空气也紧张起来了，真的感觉像是战争时期了。”
一个邻居说：“不是哪几个国家，全球都那样儿，社会上很紧张，一句话说不对，就说你是ETO或人奸，搞得人人自危。还有黄金时代的影视，开始是限制，后来全世界都成禁品了，当然东西太多也禁不住。”
“为什么？”
“怕消磨斗志呗。”史晓明说，“不过只要有饭吃，还能凑合着过，但后来，事情不妙了，全世界都开始挨饿，这大概是罗老师他们冬眠后二十多年的事吧。”
“是因为经济转型？”
“是，但环境恶化也是重要原因。当时的环保法令倒还都有，但那正是悲观时期，人们普遍都有一个想法：环保有屁用？就算把地球保成一个花园儿，还不是留给三体人？到后来，环保甚至与ETO划上等号，成了人奸行为，像绿色和平组织这类的，都给当做ETO的分支镇压了。太空军工使得高污染重工业飞速发展，环境污染是制止不了了，温室效应，气候异常，沙漠化……唉。”
“我冬眠以前正是沙漠化开始时。”另一个邻居说，“不是你们想象的那样儿，沙漠从长城那边儿向这边儿推进，不是！那叫插花式侵蚀，内地好好的一块块地方，同时开始沙化，从各个点向外扩散，就像一块儿湿布被晒干那样。”
“然后是农业大减产，储备粮耗光，然后……然后就是大低谷了。”
“生活水平倒退一百年的预言真成了现实？”罗辑问。

translated_paragraphs: In this command system, it can be said that the battleship is like a part of the body of the captain. Currently, in the 695 starship fleet owned by the Fleet, concentrated command systems are present in 179 of them, and the captains of these vessels will be the focus of the review. Originally, it was expected that during the review process, all involved ships should be undergoing restoration, but from the current situation, it is not possible to achieve this goal, and at the same time, the Three Regions Fleet is actively preparing for an interception operation against a Trisolarian probe, which is the first live combat action against a Trisolarian invader. All ships must be in standby mode at all times to prepare for this action.
So, the superior, this period must be the concentrated type of command system to the captain's authority handed over to a reliable person.
Chen Baihai said that he had been guessing his mission, but hadn't guessed it yet.
“Who can we trust?” the commander asked. “We have no idea how much the seal of thought is used, and there's no information about any clans of steampunks either, so none of us can be reliable.”

As the sun appeared outside the window, although it looked much weaker here than on Earth, his body was still hidden by the glow that radiated from the orb, with only a faint sound reaching his command post.

“But you are reliable, while in your hibernation state, the steelmind is not yet created, and it was very important for you to be chosen two centuries ago because of loyalty and faith. That is why the Fleet decided to entrust you with the command authority of the Command System; you will be appointed as the executor commander and all orders to the warships from the original commanders will have to pass through you first.”
In his eyes, two small suns were burning. He said to the boss, "This might not work."
“We don't say hello before accepting a task, this is not our tradition.”
The word “we” and the phrase “traditional” in Captain's words made Zhang Beihai feel a warm feeling. He knew that the blood of the army two centuries ago was still continued in the Space Fleet.
“Sir, we come from two centuries ago when I was in the Navy. This is like letting a captain of the late-Qing Navy command our destroyers now.”

“Do you think that Deng Shichang and Liu Stepi can't command your destroyers? They both have a good education and a good command of English. In addition, the commander-in-chief duties for space cruisers are not involved in technical details; they just give high-level orders to their crews. During your assignments as the execution squadron, the ships would be anchored at the base, which doesn't launch them at all. Your mission is to convey original commanders' orders to the systems. This can be done by studying.”
We have too much control over the ship's permissions. We can give them limited autonomy while still monitoring their orders.

“Just think carefully, and you will see that it is not feasible. If the Stampians do exist and occupy a strategic position, they can use various means to avoid surveillance, including assassinating supervisors. You should know that a warship in stand-by mode, which can be brought into service with three orders, so there is no time to prevent it.”

The submarine flies over the Jupiter fleet, and North Sea feels as if she is flying above mountains. Each mountain is a space battleship moored on Jupiter's shady side. The port runs in Jupiter's shadow at this time, and phosphorus light emitted from the planetary surface and silvery white moonlight from the orbiting Europa are silently draped over the fleet like a dome. Soon, an illuminated bubble of brilliant white light emerges at the end of the mountain range, and North Sea realizes it is witnessing a sunrise on the mountains. The fleet even casts a moving shadow in Jupiter's turbulent atmosphere as it enters port. Only until the second light cluster rises from the port opposite does North Sea realize that they are not the sun but two incoming ships slowing down their nuclear fusion engines toward the port.

The fleet commander introduced that there are more than 400 warships in the harbor, equivalent to two-thirds of the total fleet of Asian fleet and most of the remaining fleet of Asian fleet is expected to return soon.

North Sea, who was intoxicated by the magnificent view of the fleet, had to return to reality: "Chief of Staff, won't it provoke and force the Steampressors to move right away if all the vessels are recalled like this?"
Oh, no, the command to return all of our warships was based on another reason that is real and not an excuse, but sounds a bit ridiculous. Have you been keeping up with news recently?
No, I've been reading the information about the ‘Natural Selection’.

“Don’t worry too much. Based on the previous training, you guys have already mastered it very well. You can go ahead with the job after familiarizing yourself to the ship, following the step-by-step instructions without being so worried about how difficult ……Yesterday's meeting of the three fleet commands finally reached a tentative agreement: all warships in the three fleets will return to their home ports and a special committee will oversee this operation to prevent any one fleet from sending out ships by themselves to carry out an interception mission.”
Why is this necessary? If either side intercepts successfully, the information and technical knowledge obtained should be shared.

“Not, this is just an honor issue. Fleet that made first contact with alien civilization would gain political points. Why did I say ridiculous? This is a no-risk cheap deed and the biggest possible failures are only destroying probes while intercepting it, so everyone wants to do it… If this were an encounter with the main fleet of the Three Body World, everyone probably will do whatever they can in order to save their strengths. So looking at now's politics, it is roughly similar to yours then… Look, that is the ‘Natural Selection’.”
As the transport ship flew towards the "Natural Selection" in its destination, this huge mountain of steel gradually appeared.

As the words “Tang” appeared in his mind, Zhang Beihai saw a ghostly image of the “Tang” class aircraft carrier. The shape of its main hull was separate from the engine cylinder which resembled an upright cylinder. When the ‘Tang’ sank, he felt like he had lost his spiritual home although it was never his place. Now, with the ‘Natural Selection’ , Zhang Beihai felt his wandering spirit found its new home on the majestic hull of the spaceship. He seemed to be a child who rushed towards some infinite power.

The “Natural Selection” was the flagship of the Asian Fleet’s third fleet. It had the largest tonnage and the best performance in the fleet. With its advanced Noble-matter propulsion system, it could reach 15% of the speed of light with full power. The naval ecosystem within the ship was perfect and could last for extended periods of time without any major faults or defects. In fact, the experimental version of this system had started to run on the Moon in seventy-five years ago and has not encountered any major issues. The “Natural Selection”’s weaponry system was among the most powerful in the fleet. It consisted of a quartet of weapons systems including gamma ray lasers, electromagnetic cannon, high-energy particle beams, and interstellar torpedoes. These weapons were capable of destroying the entire surface of an Earth-sized planet alone.

At present, the "Natural Selection" has occupied all viewports. From the transportation ship, only a part of it can be seen. Zhang Beihai sees, the surface of the craft is perfectly smooth like a mirror, reflecting the atmosphere and ocean of Jupiter perfectly in it. Through this vast mirror, one can also see the approaching transportation ship in its reflection.

The outer wall of the spaceship appeared to be an oval shaped entrance, and the traffic craft flew straight into it and quickly slowed down before stopping. The Chief Operator opened the艙門 first and then went out. At this time, Zhang Beihai slightly tensed up because he realized that the traffic craft hadn't gone through a transition chamber, but immediately felt fresh air pouring in from the doorway of the gas-pressure bay. It was an unfamiliar technology that allowed the bay to open directly to outer space without losing its air pressure.

Zhang Beihai and the chief of staff are in a huge ball within, maximum diameter has football pitch size. The spacecraft's cabin commonly adopts this spherical structure, when the spaceship accelerates, decelerates and turns, any part of the ball may become a deck or ceiling, while in microgravity state, the center is the main activity space for personnel.

At the time when Zhang Beihai came from, the space habitat still imitated the architecture of earth buildings. So he was not used to this brand-new space habitat structure. The staff told him that here was the fighter base and now there were no starfighters in this sphere middle space. Floating in the sphere central was a formation of 2000 soldiers from the "Natural Selection" and they were all in the cryogenic suspension state.

In the early days before Chang Baichen's hibernation, countries in space started to train their teams in a zero-gravity environment and developed standard practices and drill texts. However, implementing them was difficult as personnel could only move around by mini-rocket propellers on their space suits while in a zero-gravity environment, and had no means of moving or positioning within the spacecraft unless they used force to push against walls or to stir up air with their hands. In this situation, organizing a neat formation was very difficult.

$Now, seeing thousands of people arrayed in such a well-organized floating square formation in space without any support, Zhang Banye is very surprised. Nowadays, movement in a weightless space mainly relies on magnetic belts, which are made from superconductors and contain an annular current inside that can interact with the magnetic field present all around the ship and station. By holding onto a small controller, people can move freely in the spaceship within the magnetic belt's field.
Chapter Beihai currently has a belt on, but to master it still needs to learn techniques.

Chapter Beihai looked at the space soldiers in the formation. They were all grown in the fleet and they had no earth's gravity, which made them strong and clumsy as earthlings. However, they possessed lightness and agility of the space race.

$The three officers in front of the formation were looking at the beautiful young woman, whose shoulders had four stars shining on them. She was supposed to be the captain of the spaceship ‘Natural Selection’, representing the typical space-born human. From where she was standing, she glided gracefully toward the chap and his chief of staff. Her long hair floated in a breeze beside her head and the elastic bounce of her curls added to her charming beauty. She stopped before him and he immediately trusted her because steel clan species did not have such gazes.

$“I am Captain Oriental Yanxue of the ‘Natural Selection’, ” she greeted to Zhang Beihai with a smile and a challenge in her eyes. “On behalf of my crew members, I bring you an present.” She extended her hands forward holding something strange that Zhang Beihai recognized as a gun, “If you find me to have failure or fleeing intention, you can use it to kill me.”

To go to the ground is easy, and every tree building has a mainstay that supports the dome of the underground city. You can reach the ground via the elevator inside each tree trunk, passing through more than 300 meters of strata along the way. When Lei Suo and Shi Qiang came out of the elevator, they had a feeling of nostalgia: the reason for this feeling is that there were no activated display windows on the walls or floors at the exit hall; instead, various information was displayed in the real displays suspended from the ceiling. It looked like an old subway station where not many people were wearing shiny clothes.
They stepped through the sealed door and felt a hot breeze blowing on their faces, filled with dust.

“That’s my son!” Big Shi pointed to a man who was running up the stairs and shouted. Luo Ze could only see that the man looked to be around forty years old, which made him very surprised. Strong Shi ran down the steps quickly to meet the man, while Luo Ze didn’t look at them as he concentrated on the ground in front of him.

The sky is yellow, now that Luo Zhi knows why the skies in underground cities are captured from a height of one kilometer. From ground level only blurred outlines of suns can be seen. The sand covers everything on the ground, and when vehicles pass, they drag long trails of dust. Now Luo Zhi also saw something past: In the streets, vehicles that obviously do not use petrol are driven. They are different shapes, old and new, but they have a common point: they all have a section-like thing on their roofs like an umbrella. Across the street from where Luo Zhi is standing, he sees past buildings with windows that are covered in sand or closed dead, some window frames even have flowers growing outside them. He looks far away and although the air is obscured by floating dust, he still sees two familiar architectural silhouettes so he knows this must be his old city after half a century.
He walked down the steps and approached the two men who were hugging and pounding each other excitedly. When he looked at them, he knew for sure that Mr. Shi was not making a mistake.
“Dad, I am only five years younger than you.” Shaying said while wiping the tears from his eyes.
“Okay, kid. I'm really scared to hear a white-bearded old man call me father.” Strong laughed and then introduced John Robertson to his son.
“Ah, hello, Professor Luo. You were once a world-renowned scientist!”
As they approached the car, which was parked on the roadside, Rourou stopped to ask what was on the car's roof.

“The antenna is big because it can only catch the electromagnetic waves leaking out from underground cities. It's powered by that electricity from underground city only and so it doesn't have enough power to fly.”

The car was not moving fast, and Rao Zhe wondered whether it was because of the lack of power or because they were driving on sandy terrain. He looked out the window at the city through the sandstorm and had a lot to ask about but couldn't get in any words with his father and Xue Xiaoming who were talking non-stop.
My mother passed away 34 years ago, and at that time you and your granddaughter were with her.
Oh, that's fine. No need to worry.
"After divorcing her mother, I checked the records and found that the child passed away at age 83 in crisis year 105."
"Sorry, I haven't seen your face before... When did you get out of prison?"
19 years.
What are you going to do in the future?

I did anything and anything, but I didn't have any way out. Soon after that, I started doing some regular businesses and earned some money. When the sign of the great downturn appeared, I just went into winter sleep. At that time, I didn't think about later being able to recover, but just wanted to come see you.
Are our house still there?
“Seventy years later, the property rights were renewed again but they didn't stay very long. Later on, we bought a unit that was still in use while my parents’ old house remained empty.
"Do all the revived sleepers live in the Old City?" asked Luo Ge, who had finally managed to catch a chance for a conversation.
“Where are you staying? It's too dusty outside. Of course, it's not good to be far from the underground city as we can't afford the power out here.”
“What else can you do?”, Xiangqiang asked.
You know, in this day and age, what we can't do is to farm. Just like the other sleepers, Xie Shaoming still likes to call modern people as “kids.”

As the car left the city and headed west, the sand density decreased slightly. The road became visible underneath the sand. Liao Ze recognized this to be the Jishu Expressway from years before. Nowadays, both sides of the road are thick layers of sand and the old buildings still remain standing in it. However, what truly revived the sandy plain of northern China was a small oasis surrounded by sparse stands of trees, which according to Mr. Shaoming is where the dormants live.

He got off the car and felt like time was moving backwards. He saw familiar residential buildings, elderly people playing chess on stone benches, and mothers pushing prams in sparse patches of grass growing from the sandy soil. Children were playing football on this newly formed grass…

Xiao Ming lives on the sixth floor. His current wife is nine years younger than him, and her father died of liver cancer in crisis 21. She had been in a coma for over 1500 days, but she woke up healthily after being brought back to life by artificial respiration. They have a four-year-old son named Shi Qianzoya.

As for the feast, it was very generous with homemade produce from the nearby farms and even their own wine. Three of their neighbors were also invited to join them for lunch. They are all early winterers like Xiaoming's family, but now they have all become regular people after crossing over a hundred years of time since then. Xiaoming particularly introduces a neighbor who he is sorry to say that he cheated many years ago. He is the grandson of Zhang Yuanchang, who was cheated by him.
“You didn't ask me to repay the money I stole. After I went out, I started paying it back and met Yanzi. At that time, he was newly graduated from university.”

Being called Yanshi by Shaoming, Yanzi looked a little older than his age, around 50 years old. Shaoming explained that Yanshi had awoken from hibernation for thirty-plus years before he re-entered the world of dreams again.
“What is your legal status here?” Luo Jue asked.

Shayin said, "We have the same status as modern residential areas and we are considered to be a far-flung suburb with an established district government. Here you will also find some modern people who come here to play."
He continued, “We call modern people ‘wallers’ because they tended to point at the wall when they first came here. They wanted to bring something back to life.”
“How's it going?” 史强 asked.
Several people said it was good.
But I see the land where you plant your crops and the fruit grows, able to sustain people?

“Why can't it? Nowadays, agricultural products are considered luxury goods in cities… The government is quite considerate to us winter sleepers; just passively wait for the subsidies from the government and still live a comfortable life. But we need find something to do as well, saying that winter sleepers can farm sounds absurd, because nobody was farmers when they were born, but at least, we could also grow vegetables.”
The conversation quickly shifted to the two centuries of modern history.
“What’s the big deal about the Great Depression?”
As the face of people suddenly became serious, Shi Xiaoming looked at his plate to see that the food was almost finished, so he continued the conversation.

“You guys know a bit more than that. These days, after we woke up from our sleep, life is still okay for a few years but then things just get worse and the political climate becomes tense. It really feels like the period before the war.”

One of my neighbors said, "It's not just a few countries like that. The world is tense, and if you say something wrong, they will say you are ETO or being inhuman. And people feel anxious as well." In addition, there was also too much entertainment, starting with restrictions and eventually becoming a global ban, of course.
Why?

"I'm afraid it drains our motivation," said Shaoming. "But as long as we have food to eat, we can still hold on. Later, however, the world starves, and this may be due to what happened twenty-something years ago."
Is it because of the economic transition?

“Yes, but environmental deterioration is also an important reason. At that time, there were environmental regulations in effect, but that was a pessimistic era, and people generally had the idea: what good does it do for environmental protection? Even if we keep the Earth as a garden, it's not for humans, like Greenpeace, this kind of organization, which has been suppressed as a branch of ETO. Space industry allows rapid development of high-pollution heavy industry and can no longer be prevented from polluting, such as global warming, climate abnormalities, desertification…Sigh.”

“I was in a deep sleep when desertification began,” said another neighbor. “It’s not what you think. Desertification doesn’t spread from the Great Wall and goes to here. It’s called ‘fleeting erosion, ” he explained. "The interior is actually quite good places with the sand moving out from each point and diffusing all over. It's like a wet cloth being air-dried.”
“Then is the big decline in agricultural production, exhaustion of reserves, then... there will be a great depression.”
“Is the prophecy of living standards going back a hundred years really coming true?” Luo Ge asked.
